column4: i'm installing ubuntu on a laptop with 2GB RAM, how much swap do i need (for hibernate to work, I need more swap than RAM?)
the old convention was for 1.5 times RAM, but in modern day computing thats a waste of disk space. Go for a gb
hibernate copies the contents of RAM into swap, so I think you need more swap than RAM for it to work
that assumes RAM is fully in use, but hmm you might have apoint
